Class ShipList

java.lang.Object
  ShipList

public class ShipList
extends java.lang.Object

Ship is the class to hold the list of ship objects and handles movement and firing cannons. New ships are created by calling addShip and removed with removeShip.

The server calls methods on this class to update the speed and positions of all the ships in play. Firing cannons are also handled in this class when a request is made by a client.

This class also holds an instance of the Map class. The map is created and transmitted to the clients. During movement, the Map object is used to check for wind and collisions.

See Also:
Map

Field Detail

MAX_PLAYERS

public static final int MAX_PLAYERS
Maximum number of players this class can handle is 6.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

activeShips

public int[] activeShips
Array to hold the status of each ship slot. There are 6 slots.
  • 0 = slot empty
  • 1 = slot occupied

    • ships

    public Ship[] ships
    Array to hold a ship object for each occupied ship slot. There are 6 slots. Null indicates an empty slot.

    currentMap

    public Map currentMap
    Represents the current state of the map. Used to check for collisions and get information about the map state.

    Constructor Detail

    ShipList

    public ShipList()
    Constructor to start a new list of ships. A map object is also created to represent the current state of the game map.

    Method Detail

    addShip

    public boolean addShip(int newShipID,
                       int newShipType,
                       int newXPos,
                       int newYPos)
    Adds a new ship in the appropriate slot. If the ship id provided is invalid or the slot is occupied, false is returned.

    Parameters:
    newShipID - id of the ship being added
    newShipType - type of the ship being added
    newYPos - starting y position of the ship in metres
    newXPos - starting x position of the ship in metres
    Returns:
    true if ship is successfully added otherwise false (if the slot is occupied or the slot number is invalid)

    removeShip

    public boolean removeShip(int remShipID)
    Removes a ship from the given slot.

    Parameters:
    remShipID - id number of the ship to be removed
    Returns:
    true if the ship is removed and false if the ship id is invalid

    changeHeading

    public void changeHeading(int shipID,
                          int headingChange)
    Adjusts the heading for a given ship.

    Parameters:
    shipID - id number of the ship to be adjusted
    headingChange - change in degrees of the heading (positive = clockwise, negative = counter-clockwise)

    setShipSpeed

    public void setShipSpeed(int shipID,
                         float newSpeedSetting)
    Sets the percentage of max speed available for the ship. Set when the client wants to speed up or slow down. Value is a decimal between 0 and 1 (inclusive).
  • 0 = stopped
  • 1 = full speed

    Parameters:
    shipID - id of the ship of interest
    newSpeedSetting - desired speed setting for the ship (0-1)

    • updateShips

    public boolean updateShips(int timeIntervalMS)
    Updates the speed and positions of all the ships for a given time interval.

    Parameters:
    timeIntervalMS - time interval to update over in milliseconds
    Returns:
    true on success; false on failure

    fireCannon

    public boolean fireCannon(int shooterID,
                          int targetID)
    Called when a client ship fires a cannon at another ship. This method accepts the shooter and target id and determines whether a hit is made. The health of a hit ship is then updated. A successful hit causes 0.5 points of damage.

    Parameters:
    shooterID - id of the ship firing the cannon
    targetID - id of the ship being fired at
    Returns:
    true if a hit is successful and false if it misses

    findWindSpeedFactor

    public static double findWindSpeedFactor(int windDirection,
                                         int shipDirection)
    Supplies the wind speed factor given the direction of the ship and wind.

    The relative angle between the wind and the ship is first calculated. This relative angle is then used as an index to look up the actual wind speed factor.

    Parameters:
    windDirection - current direction of the wind (0-359)
    shipDirection - current direction the ship is facing (0-359)
    Returns:
    wind speed factor for the ship given the current wind direction

    main

    public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
    Main method used only for testing this class individually.

    Parameters:
    args - not used
